Package com.vaadin.polymer.platinum

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    PlatinumBluetoothCharacteristicElement
    The <platinum-bluetooth-characteristic> element allows you to read
    and write characteristics on nearby bluetooth devices     thanks to the
    young Web Bluetooth API.
    PlatinumBluetoothDeviceElement
    The <platinum-bluetooth-device> element allows you to discover nearby
    bluetooth devices     thanks to the young Web Bluetooth API.
    PlatinumBluetoothServiceElement
    The <platinum-bluetooth-service> element is used in conjuction with
    the <platinum-bluetooth-characteristic> element to read and write
    characteristics on nearby bluetooth devices     thanks to the young Web
    Bluetooth API    .
    PlatinumHttpsRedirectElement
    The <platinum-https-redirect> element redirects the current page to HTTPS, unless the page is
    loaded from a web server running on localhost.
    PlatinumPushMessagingElement
    <platinum-push-messaging> sets up a push messaging subscription
    and allows you to define what happens when a push message is received.
    PlatinumSwCacheElement
    The <platinum-sw-cache> element makes it easy to precache specific resources, perform runtime
    caching, and serve your cached resources when a network is unavailable.
    Under the hood, the sw-toolbox library is used
    for all the caching and request handling logic.
    <platinum-sw-cache> needs to be a child element of <platinum-sw-register>.
    A simple, yet useful configuration is
    PlatinumSwFetchElement
    The <platinum-sw-fetch> element creates custom fetch event
    handlers for given URL patterns.
    PlatinumSwImportScriptElement
    The <platinum-sw-import-script> element is used to import a JavaScript file that is executed
    each time the service worker starts up.
    PlatinumSwOfflineAnalyticsElement
    The <platinum-sw-offline-analytics> element registers a service worker handler to
    intercepts requests for Google Analytics pings.
    PlatinumSwRegisterElement
    The <platinum-sw-register> element handles
    service worker
    registration, reflects the overall service worker state, and coordinates the configuration
    provided by other Service Worker Elements.
    <platinum-sw-register> is used as a parent element for child elements in the
    <platinum-sw-*> group.
